Ginsburg was appointed by President Bill Clinton and took the oath of office on August 10, 1993. She is the second female justice (after Sandra Day O'Connor) of four to be confirmed to the court (along with Sonia Sotomayor and Elena Kagan, who are still serving). Ginsburg was born in Brooklyn, New York. She attended Cornell University, where she was a member of Phi Beta Kappa and graduated tied for first in her class with a Bachelor of Arts degree in government in 1954. She married Martin D. Ginsburg in 1954. The next year, she became a mother while attending Harvard Law School, where she was one of the few women in her class. She graduated from Harvard with a Bachelor of Laws in 1959.||politics||law||biography||||3617209147039,3617209170318,3617209333357,3617209732652

4647||Rage||Bob Woodward||8||2020||http://books.google.ca/books?id=79j9DwAAQBAJ&printsec=frontcover&dq=isbn:9781982131739&hl=&cd=1&source=gbs_api||||https://storage.googleapis.com/du-prd/books/images/9781982131739.jpg||Based on 17 on-the-record interviews with President Trump and other reporting, the Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist details the president\'s perspective on multiple crises.||Bob Woodward is an American investigative journalist and non-fiction author. He has worked for The Washington Post since 1971 as a reporter and is now an associate editor of the Post. While a young reporter for The Washington Post in 1972, Woodward was teamed up with Carl Bernstein; the two did much of the original news reporting on the Watergate scandal. These scandals led to numerous government investigations and the eventual resignation of President Richard Nixon. The work of Woodward and Bernstein was called "maybe the single greatest reporting effort of all time" by longtime journalism figure Gene Roberts.||politics||current affairs||nonfiction||||3617209147039,3617209333357,3617209732652

She's doing pretty well too, right up until she's forced to move back to her hometown of Tucson, Arizona. There, among the ghosts of her past, Charlotte pieces together her life, discovering that it's okay to be broken, because you can still be beautiful.
